author: ryanleeschneider
content: Are there any L2s that use the EL/CL separation to their advantage by basically replacing the CL side but using fully "standard" mainnet-compatible EL clients via the engine API?

author: ajsutton
content:
You probably canâ€™t do it with a fully standard client as you need some way to do deposits that mint eth (at least as far as the L2 is concerned - the eth is bridged from L1). 
The OP stack design is based on that approach though so it uses a custom consensus layer that drives an execution client via the engine api. The diff required from normal geth to op-geth is pretty small (https://op-geth.optimism.io)
